Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Incinerate \In*cin"er*ate\, [LL. incineratus, p. p. of incinerare to incinerate; L. pref. in- in + cinis, cineris, ashes.] Reduced to ashes by burning; thoroughly consumed by fire. [Obs.] --Bacon. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Incinerate \In*cin"er*ate\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Incinerated}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Incinerating}.] To burn to ashes; to consume by fire; to burn. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]
It is the fire only that incinerates bodies. --Boyle. [1913 Webster]
incinerate v 1: become reduced to ashes; "The paper incinerated quickly" 2: cause to undergo combustion; "burn garbage"; "The car burns only Diesel oil" [syn: {burn}]
